articles.title: Day of Sun Observed in Different Countries
Candlelight Rally Held in Seoul
Anti-U.S. Resistance Called for
articles.content:
Candlelight Rally Held in Seoul 
    Pyongyang, April 24 (KCNA) -- The 4th Seoul regional candlelight rally against the expansion of the U.S. military base in Phyongthaek was held in the area of Kwanghwamun in Seoul on April 20 under the sponsorship of the All-people Measure Committee for Checking the Expansion of the U.S. Military Base in Phyongthaek.
 At the rally the speakers said with indignation that the residents in Phyongthaek have suffered immeasurable misfortune and pain from the moves for expansion of the U.S. military base conducted according to the U.S. "new military strategy" for supremacy in Northeast Asia.    
 There is no reason for the U.S. military base to exist in this land, they said, calling upon all the people not to offer even one phyong of land to the U.S. forces.

National Meeting Held to Celebrate Anniversary of KPA
Floral Basket and Congratulatory Letter to Kim Jong Il
South Side's Delegation to Inter-Korean Ministerial Talks Leaves
articles.content:
Floral Basket and Congratulatory Letter to Kim Jong Il
    Pyongyang, April 24 (KCNA) -- Supreme Commander of the Korean People's Army Kim Jong Il was presented with a floral basket and a congratulatory letter by the military attaches corps here on the occasion of the 74th founding anniversary of the heroic KPA.
 They were conveyed to an official concerned by Military Attache of the Cuban embassy here Giraldo Abreu Morales who is the doyen of the corps today.

articles.title: Soldier Family
articles.content:
South Side's Delegation to Inter-Korean Ministerial Talks Leaves
    Pyongyang, April 24 (KCNA) -- A south side's delegation with Minister of Unification Ri Jong Sok as its chief delegate left Pyongyang today after participating in the 18th inter-Korean ministerial talks.
 The head of the north side's delegation to the talks hosted a reception for the south side's delegation at Pyongyang Koryo Hotel Sunday evening.    
 The south side's delegation inspected the e-library of Kim Chaek University of Technology on the sidelines of the talks.

articles.title: Round-plate Wind Power Generator Made
Evening Gala of Servicepersons Held
articles.content:
Round-plate Wind Power Generator Made
    Pyongyang, April 24 (KCNA) -- The Electricity Institute under the State Academy of Sciences of the DPRK has recently developed a new kind of low speed round-plate wind power generator.
 The generator has a larger output of electricity and less mechanical electric loss than the existing ones without using exciting coil, electric brush and speedup apparatus.
 It consists of three round plates (two magnetic round plates and one coil round plate), six wind-impellers and a wing for keeping direction.    
 It, low in production cost, can be operated from the wind-speed of 1.5 meters per second. 
 It produces 300 watts of electricity in wind-speed of 5 meters per second.
 Such generators have already been introduced into lots of families in western coastal areas including Uiju and Kangryong Counties, showing a great profitability.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets President of Senate of Philippines
Reception for Military Attaches Corps Here
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets President of Senate of Philippines
    Pyongyang, April 24 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a friendly talk with President of the Senate of the Philippines Franklin M. Drillon at the Mansudae Assembly Hall today. 
 On hand were Kang Nung Su, vice-chairman of the Supreme People's Assembly, officials concerned and Senators Aquilino Q. Pimentel and Richard J. Gordon, Chairman of the National Commission for Culture and the Arts Ambeth R. Ocampo and others.    
 On the occasion the president of the Senate of the Philippines underlined the need to boost the bilateral relations through the exchanges between the two parliaments and expressed the determination to work hard to develop the friendly relations between the two countries.

articles.title: Ro Tu Chol Meets Delegation of Finnish Mondo Minerals Company
articles.content:
Reception for Military Attaches Corps Here
    Pyongyang, April 24 (KCNA) -- The Ministry of the People's Armed Forces hosted a reception for the military attaches corps here on Monday on the occasion of the 74th anniversary of the Korean People's Army.
 Present on invitation were military attaches of foreign embassies here.
 Also present there were Vice-Minister of the People's Armed Forces Jong Chang Ryol and general officers and officers of the KPA.    
 Speeches were made there.

articles.title: Joint Press Release on 18th Inter-Korean Ministerial Talks Published
articles.content:
Ro Tu Chol Meets Delegation of Finnish Mondo Minerals Company
    Pyongyang, April 24 (KCNA) -- Vice-Premier of the DPRK Cabinet Ro Tu Chol met and had a conversation with a delegation of Finnish Mondo Minerals Company headed by General Manager Wulf-Dietrich Keller at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Monday.
 On hand were Paek Hyon Bong, chairman of the DPRK Committee for Promotion of External Economic Cooperation, and officials concerned.    
 On the occasion the head of the delegation said that they will make active efforts for economic cooperation with the DPRK, wishing the Korean people led by Kim Jong Il greater progress and prosperity.
